compoundProblem.pl

00001 sub _compoundProblem_init {};   # don't reload this file
00002 
00003 ######################################################################
00004 #
00005 #  This package implements a method of handling multi-part problems
00006 #  that show only a single part at any one time.  The students can
00007 #  work on one part at a time, and then when they get it right (or
00008 #  under other circumstances deterimed by the professor), they can
00009 #  move on to the next part.  Students can not return to earlier parts
00010 #  once they have been completed.  The score for problem as a whole is
00011 #  made up from the scores on the individual parts, and the relative
00012 #  weighting of the various parts can be specified by the problem
00013 #  author.
00014 #
00015 #  To use the compoundProblem library, use
00016 #
00017 #      loadMacros("compoundProblem.pl");
00018 #
00019 #  at the top of your file, and then create a compoundProblem object
00020 #  via the command
00021 #
00022 #      $cp = new compoundProblem(options)
00023 #
00024 #  where '$cp' is the name of a variable that you will use to
00025 #  refer to the compound problem, and 'options' can include:
00026 #
00027 #    parts => n                The number of parts in the problem.
00028 #                                Default: 1
00029 #
00030 #    weights => [n1,...,nm]    The relative weights to give to each
00031 #                              part in the problem.  For example,
00032 #                                  weights => [2,1,1]
00033 #                              would cause the first part to be worth 50%
00034 #                              of the points (twice the amount for each of
00035 #                              the other two), while the second and third
00036 #                              part would be worth 25% each.  If weights
00037 #                              are not supplied, the parts are weighted
00038 #                              by the number of answer blanks in each part
00039 #                              (and you must provide the total number of
00040 #                              blanks in all the parts by supplying the
00041 #                              totalAnswers option).
00042 #
00043 #    totalAnswers => n         The total number of answer blanks in all
00044 #                              the parts put together (this is used when
00045 #                              computing the per-part scores, if part
00046 #                              weights are not provided).
00047 #
00048 #    saveAllAnswers => 0 or 1  Usually, the contents of named answer blanks
00049 #                              from previous parts are made available to
00050 #                              later parts using variables with the
00051 #                              same name as the answer blank.  Setting
00052 #                              saveAllAnswers to 1 will cause ALL answer
00053 #                              blanks to be available (via variables
00054 #                              like $AnSwEr1, and so on).
00055 #                                 Default:  0
00056 #
00057 #    parserValues => 0 or 1    Determines whether the answers from previous
00058 #                              parts are returned as MathObjects (like
00059 #                              those returned from Real(), Vector(), etc)
00060 #                              or as strings (the unparsed contents of the
00061 #                              student answer).  If you intend to use the
00062 #                              previous answers as numbers, for example,
00063 #                              you would want to set this to 1 so that you
00064 #                              would get the final result of any formula
00065 #                              the student typed, rather than the formula
00066 #                              itself as a character string.
00067 #                                 Default:  0
00068 #
00069 #    nextVisible => type       Tells when the "go on to the next part" option
00070 #                              is available to the student.  The possible
00071 #                              types include:
00072 #
00073 #                                 'ifCorrect'   next is available only when
00074 #                                               all the answers are correct.
00075 #
00076 #                                 'Always'      next is always available
00077 #                                               (but remember that students
00078 #                                               can't go back once they go
00079 #                                               on.)
00080 #
00081 #                                 'Never'       next is never allowed (the
00082 #                                               problem will control going
00083 #                                               on to the next part itself).
00084 #
00085 #                                Default:  'ifCorrect'
00086 #
00087 #    nextStyle => type         Determines the style of "next" indicator to display
00088 #                              (when it is available).  The type can be one of:
00089 #
00090 #                                 'CheckBox'    a checkbox that allows the students
00091 #                                               to go on to the next part when they
00092 #                                               submit their answers.
00093 #
00094 #                                 'Button'      a button that submits their answers
00095 #                                               and goes on to the next part.
00096 #
00097 #                                 'Forced'      forces the student to go on to the
00098 #                                               next part the next time they submit
00099 #                                               answers.
00100 #
00101 #                                 'HTML'        allows you to provide an arbitrary
00102 #                                               HTML string of your own.
00103 #
00104 #                                Default:  'Checkbox'
00105 #
00106 #    nextLabel => string       Specifies the string to use as the label for the checkbox,
00107 #                              the name of the button, the text of the message indicating
00108 #                              that the next submit will move to the next part, or the
00109 #                              HTML string, depending on the setting of nextStyle above.
00110 #
00111 #    nextNoChange => 0 or 1    Since the students must submit their answers again to go on
00112 #                              to the next part, it is possible for them to change their
00113 #                              answers before they submit, and if nextVisible is 'ifCorrect'
00114 #                              they might go on to the next without having correct answers
00115 #                              stored.  This option lets you control whether the answers
00116 #                              are checked against the previous ones before going on to the
00117 #                              next part.  If the answers don't match, a warning is issued
00118 #                              and they are not allowed to move on.
00119 #                                Default:  1
00120 #
00121 #    allowReset => 0 or 1      Determines whether a "Go back to the first part" checkbox
00122 #                              is provided on parts 2 and later.  This is intended for
00123 #                              the professor during testing of the problem (otherwise
00124 #                              it would be impossible to go back to earlier parts).
00125 #                                Default:  0
00126 #
00127 #    resetLabel => string      The string used to label the reset checkbox.
00128 #
00129 #  Once you have created a compoundProblem object, you can use $cp->part to
00130 #  determine the part that the student is working on, and use 'if' statements
00131 #  to display the proper information for the given part.  The compoundProblem
00132 #  object takes care of maintaining the data as the parts change.  (See the
00133 #  compoundProblem.pg file for an example of a compound problem.)
00134 #
00135 #  In order to handle the scoring of the problem as a whole when only part is
00136 #  showing, the compoundProblem object uses its own problem grader to manage
00137 #  the scores, and calls your own grader from there.  The default is to use
00138 #  the one that was installed before the compoundProblem object was created,
00139 #  or avg_problem_grader if none was installed.  You can specify a different
00140 #  one using the $cp->useGrader() method (see below).  It is important that
00141 #  you NOT call install_problem_grader() yourself once you have created the
00142 #  compoundProblem object, as that would disable the special grader, causing
00143 #  the compound problem to fail to work properly.
00144 #
00145 #  You may call the following methods once you have a compoundProblem:
00146 #
00147 #    $cp->part                   Returns the part the student is working on.
00148 #    $cp->part(n)                Sets the part to be part n, as long as the
00149 #                                student has finished the preceeding parts.
00150 #                                If not, the part is set to the highest
00151 #                                one the student hasn't completed, and he
00152 #                                can work up to the given part.  (The
00153 #                                nextVisible option is set to 'ifCorrect' if
00154 #                                it was 'Never' so that students can go on
00155 #                                once they finish the earlier parts.)
00156 #
00157 #    $cp->useGrader(code_ref)    Supplies your own grader to use in
00158 #                                place of the default one.  For example:
00159 #                                  $cp->useGrader(~~&std_problem_grader);
00160 #
00161 #    $cp->score                  Returns the (weighted) score for this part.
00162 #                                Note that this is the score shown at the bottom
00163 #                                of the page on which the student pressed submit
00164 #                                (not the score for the answers the student is
00165 #                                submitting -- that is not available until
00166 #                                after the body of the problem has been created).
00167 #
00168 #    $cp->scoreRaw               Returns the unweighted score for this part.
00169 #
00170 #    $cp->scoreOverall           Returns the overall score for the problem
00171 #                                so far.
00172 #
00173 #    $cp->addAnswers(list)       Make additional answer blanks be available
00174 #                                from one part to another.  E.g.,
00175 #                                   $cp->addAnswers('AnSwEr1');
00176 #                                would make the first unnamed blank be available
00177 #                                in later parts as well.  (This command should
00178 #                                be issued only when the part containing the
00179 #                                given answer blank is displayed.)
00180 #
00181 #    $cp->nextCheckbox(label)    Returns the HTML string for the "go on to next
00182 #                                part" checkbox so you can use it in the body of
00183 #                                the problem if you wish.  This should not be
00184 #                                inserted when the $displayMode is 'TeX'.  If the
00185 #                                label is not given or is blank, the default label
00186 #                                is used.
00187 #
00188 #    $cp->nextButton(label)      Returns the HTML string for the "go on to next
00189 #                                part" button so you can use it in the body of
00190 #                                the problem if you wish.  This should not be
00191 #                                inserted when the $displayMode is 'TeX'.  If the
00192 #                                label is not given or is blank, the default label
00193 #                                is used.
00194 #
00195 #    $cp->nextForces(label)      Returns the HTML string for the forced "go on to
00196 #                                next part" so you can use it in the body of
00197 #                                the problem if you wish.  This should not be
00198 #                                inserted when the $displayMode is 'TeX'.  If the
00199 #                                label is not given or is blank, the default label
00200 #                                is used.
00201 #
00202 #    $cp->reset                  Go back to part 1, clearing the answers
00203 #                                and score.  (Best used when debugging problems.)
00204 #
00205 #    $cp->resetCheckbox(label)   Returns the HTML string for the reset checkbox
00206 #                                so that you can provide one within the body
00207 #                                of the problem if you wish.  This should not be
00208 #                                inserted when the $displayMode is 'TeX'.  If the
00209 #                                label is not given or is blank, the default label
00210 #                                will be used.
00211 #
00212 
00213 ######################################################################
00214 
00215 
00216 package compoundProblem;
00217 
00218 #
00219 #  The state data that is stored between invocations of
00220 #  the problem.
00221 #
00222 our %defaultStatus = (
00223   part => 1,                # the current part
00224   answers => "",            # answer labels from previous parts
00225   new_answers => "",        # answer labels for THIS part
00226   ans_rule_count => 0,      # the ans_rule count from previous parts
00227   new_ans_rule_count => 0,  # the ans_rule count from THIS part
00228   images_created => 0,      # the image count from the precious parts
00229   new_images_created => 0,  # the image count from THIS part
00230   imageName => "",          # name of images_created image file
00231   score => 0,               # the (weighted) score on this part
00232   total => 0,               # the total on previous parts
00233   raw => 0,                 # raw score on this part
00234 );
00235 
00236 #
00237 #  Create a new instance of the compound Problem and initialize
00238 #  it.  This includes reading the status from the previous
00239 #  parts, defining the variables from the answers to previous parts,
00240 #  and setting up the grader so that the current data can be saved.
00241 #
00242 sub new {
00243   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00244   my $cp = bless {
00245     parts => 1,
00246     totalAnswers => undef,
00247     weights => undef,            # array of weights per part
00248     saveAllAnswers => 0,         # usually only save named answers
00249     parserValues => 0,           # make Parser objects from the answers?
00250     nextVisible => "ifCorrect",  # or "Always" or "Never"
00251     nextStyle   => "Checkbox",   # or "Button", "Forced", or "HTML"
00252     nextLabel   => undef,        # Checkbox text or button name or HTML
00253     nextNoChange => 1,           # true if answer can't change for new part
00254     allowReset => 0,             # true to show "back to part 1" button
00255     resetLabel => undef,         # label for reset button
00256     grader => $main::PG->{flags}->{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE} || \&main::avg_problem_grader,
00257     @_,
00258     status => $defaultStatus,
00259   }, $class;
00260   die "You must provide either the totalAnswers or weights"
00261     unless $cp->{totalAnswers} || $cp->{weights};
00262   $cp->getTotalWeight if $cp->{weights};
00263   main::loadMacros("Parser.pl") if $cp->{parserValues};
00264   $cp->reset if $cp->{allowReset} && $main::inputs_ref->{_reset};
00265   $cp->getStatus;
00266   $cp->initPart;
00267   return $cp;
00268 }
00269 
00270 #
00271 #  Compute the total of the weights so that the parts can
00272 #  be properly scaled.
00273 #
00274 sub getTotalWeight {
00275   my $self = shift;
00276   $self->{totalWeight} = 0; $self->{totalAnswers} = 1;
00277   foreach my $w (@{$self->{weights}}) {$self->{totalWeight} += $w}
00278   $self->{totalWeight} = 1 if $self->{totalWeight} == 0;
00279 }
00280 
00281 #
00282 #  Look up the status from the previous invocation
00283 #  and see if we need to go on to the next part.
00284 #
00285 sub getStatus {
00286   my $self = shift;
00287   main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL("_next");
00288   main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL("_status");
00289   $self->{status} = $self->decode;
00290   $self->{isNew} = $main::inputs_ref->{_next} || ($main::inputs_ref->{submitAnswers} &&
00291      $main::inputs_ref->{submitAnswers} eq ($self->{nextLabel} || "Go on to Next Part"));
00292   if ($self->{isNew}) {
00293     $self->checkAnswers;
00294     $self->incrementPart unless $self->{nextNoChange} && $self->{answersChanged};
00295   }
00296 }
00297 
00298 #
00299 #  Initialize the current part by setting the ans_rule
00300 #  count (so that later parts will get unique answer names),
00301 #  installing the grader (to save the data), and setting
00302 #  the variables for previous answers.
00303 #
00304 sub initPart {
00305   my $self = shift;
00306   $main::ans_rule_count = $self->{status}{ans_rule_count};
00307   $main::images_created{$self->{status}{imageName}} = $self->{status}{images_created}
00308     if $self->{status}{imageName};
00309   main::install_problem_grader(\&compoundProblem::grader);
00310   $main::PG->{flags}->{compoundProblem} = $self;
00311   $self->initAnswers($self->{status}{answers});
00312 }
00313 
00314 #
00315 #  Look through the list of answer labels and set
00316 #  the variables for them to be the associated student
00317 #  answer.  Make it a Parser value if requested.
00318 #  Record the value so that is will be available
00319 #  again on the next invocation.
00320 #
00321 sub initAnswers {
00322   my $self = shift; my $answers = shift;
00323   foreach my $id (split(/;/,$answers)) {
00324     my $value = $main::inputs_ref->{$id}; $value = '' unless defined($value);
00325     if ($self->{parserValues}) {
00326       my $parser = Parser::Formula($value);
00327       $parser = Parser::Evaluate($parser) if $parser && $parser->isConstant;
00328       $value = $parser if $parser;
00329     }
00330     ${"main::$id"} = $value unless $id =~ m/$main::ANSWER_PREFIX/o;
00331     $value = quoteHTML($value);
00332     main::TEXT(qq!<input type="hidden" name="$id" value="$value" />!);
00333     main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL($id);
00334   }
00335 }
00336 
00337 #
00338 #  Look to see is any answers have changed on this
00339 #  invocation of the problem.
00340 #
00341 sub checkAnswers {
00342   my $self = shift;
00343   foreach my $id (keys(%{$main::inputs_ref})) {
00344     if ($id =~ m/^previous_(.*)$/) {
00345       if ($main::inputs_ref->{$id} ne $main::inputs_ref->{$1}) {
00346     $self->{answersChanged} = 1;
00347     $self->{isNew} = 0 if $self->{nextNoChange};
00348     return;
00349       }
00350     }
00351   }
00352 }
00353 
00354 #
00355 #  Go on to the next part, updating the status
00356 #  to include the data from the old part so that
00357 #  it will be properly preserved when the next
00358 #  part is showing.
00359 #
00360 sub incrementPart {
00361   my $self = shift;
00362   my $status = $self->{status};
00363   if ($status->{part} < $self->{parts}) {
00364     $status->{part}++;
00365     $status->{answers} .= ';' if $status->{answers};
00366     $status->{answers} .= $status->{new_answers};
00367     $status->{ans_rule_count} = $status->{new_ans_rule_count};
00368     $status->{images_created} = $status->{new_images_created};
00369     $status->{total} += $status->{score};
00370     $status->{score} = $status->{raw} = 0;
00371     $status->{new_answers} = '';
00372   }
00373 }
00374 
00375 ######################################################################
00376 
00377 #
00378 #  Encode all the status information so that it can be
00379 #  maintained as the student submits answers.  Since this
00380 #  state information includes things like the score from
00381 #  the previous parts, it is "encrypted" using a dumb
00382 #  hex encoding (making it harder for a student to recognize
00383 #  it as valuable data if they view the page source).
00384 #
00385 sub encode {
00386   my $self = shift; my $status = shift || $self->{status};
00387   my @data = (); my $data = "";
00388   foreach my $id (main::lex_sort(keys(%defaultStatus))) {push(@data,$status->{$id})}
00389   foreach my $c (split(//,join('|',@data))) {$data .= toHex($c)}
00390   return $data;
00391 }
00392 
00393 #
00394 #  Decode the data and break it into the status hash.
00395 #
00396 sub decode {
00397   my $self = shift; my $status = shift || $main::inputs_ref->{_status};
00398   return {%defaultStatus} unless $status;
00399   my @data = (); foreach my $hex (split(/(..)/,$status)) {push(@data,fromHex($hex)) if $hex ne ''}
00400   @data = split('\\|',join('',@data)); $status = {%defaultStatus};
00401   if (scalar(@data) == 8) {
00402     # insert imageName, images_created, new_images_created, if missing
00403     splice(@data,2,0,"",0); splice(@data,6,0,0);
00404   }
00405   foreach my $id (main::lex_sort(keys(%defaultStatus))) {$status->{$id} = shift(@data)}
00406   return $status;
00407 }
00408 
00409 
00410 #
00411 #  Hex encoding is shifted by 10 to obfuscate it further.
00412 #  (shouldn't be a problem since the status will be made of
00413 #  printable characters, so they are all above ASCII 32)
00414 #
00415 sub toHex {main::spf(ord(shift)-10,"%X")}
00416 sub fromHex {main::spf(hex(shift)+10,"%c")}
00417 
00418 
00419 #
00420 #  Make sure the data can be properly preserved within
00421 #  an HTML <INPUT TYPE="HIDDEN"> tag.
00422 #
00423 sub quoteHTML {
00424   my $string = shift;
00425   $string =~ s/&/\&amp;/g; $string =~ s/"/\&quot;/g;
00426   $string =~ s/>/\&gt;/g;  $string =~ s/</\&lt;/g;
00427   return $string;
00428 }
00429 
00430 ######################################################################
00431 
00432 #
00433 #  Set the grader for this part to the specified one.
00434 #
00435 sub useGrader {
00436   my $self = shift;
00437   $self->{grader} = shift;
00438 }
00439 
00440 #
00441 #  Make additional answer blanks from the current part
00442 #  be preserved for use in future parts.
00443 #
00444 sub addAnswers {
00445   my $self = shift;
00446   $self->{extraAnswers} = [] unless $self->{extraAnswers};
00447   push(@{$self->{extraAnswers}},@_);
00448 }
00449 
00450 #
00451 #  Go back to part 1 and clear the answers and scores.
00452 #
00453 sub reset {
00454   my $self = shift;
00455   if ($main::inputs_ref->{_status}) {
00456     my $status = $self->decode($main::inputs_ref->{_status});
00457     foreach my $id (split(/;/,$status->{answers})) {delete $main::inputs_ref->{$id}}
00458     foreach my $id (1..$status->{ans_rule_count})
00459       {delete $main::inputs_ref->{"${main::QUIZ_PREFIX}${main::ANSWER_PREFIX}$id"}}
00460   }
00461   $main::inputs_ref->{_status} = $self->encode(\%defaultStatus);
00462   $main::inputs_ref->{_next} = 0;
00463 }
00464 
00465 #
00466 #  Return the HTML for the "Go back to part 1" checkbox.
00467 #
00468 sub resetCheckbox {
00469   my $self = shift;
00470   my $label = shift || " <b>Go back to Part 1</b> (when you submit your answers).";
00471   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? $main::PAR : '');
00472   qq'$par<input type="checkbox" name="_reset" value="1" />$label';
00473 }
00474 
00475 #
00476 #  Return the HTML for the "next part" checkbox.
00477 #
00478 sub nextCheckbox {
00479   my $self = shift;
00480   my $label = shift || " <b>Go on to next part</b> (when you submit your answers).";
00481   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? $main::PAR : '');
00482   $self->{nextInserted} = 1;
00483   qq!$par<input type="checkbox" name="_next" value="next" />$label!;
00484 }
00485 
00486 #
00487 #  Return the HTML for the "next part" button.
00488 #
00489 sub nextButton {
00490   my $self = shift;
00491   my $label = quoteHTML(shift || "Go on to Next Part");
00492   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? $main::PAR : '');
00493   $par . qq!<input type="submit" name="submitAnswers" value="$label" !
00494        .      q!onclick="document.getElementById('_next').value=1" />!;
00495 }
00496 
00497 #
00498 #  Return the HTML for when going to the next part is forced.
00499 #
00500 sub nextForced {
00501   my $self = shift;
00502   my $label = shift || "<b>Submit your answers again to go on to the next part.</b>";
00503   $label = $main::PAR . $label if shift;
00504   $self->{nextInserted} = 1;
00505   qq!$label<input type="hidden" name="_next" id="_next" value="Next" />!;
00506 }
00507 
00508 #
00509 #  Return the raw HTML provided
00510 #
00511 sub nextHTML {shift; shift}
00512 
00513 ######################################################################
00514 
00515 #
00516 #  Return the current part, or try to set the part to the given
00517 #  part (returns the part actually set, which may be earlier if
00518 #  the student didn't complete an earlier part).
00519 #
00520 sub part {
00521   my $self = shift; my $status = $self->{status};
00522   my $part = shift;
00523   return $status->{part} unless defined $part && $main::displayMode ne 'TeX';
00524   $part = 1 if $part < 1; $part = $self->{parts} if $part > $self->{parts};
00525   if ($part > $status->{part} && !$main::inputs_ref->{_noadvance}) {
00526     unless ((lc($self->{nextVisible}) eq 'ifcorrect' && $status->{raw} < 1) ||
00527              lc($self->{nextVisible}) eq 'never') {
00528       $self->initAnswers($status->{new_answers});
00529       $self->incrementPart; $self->{isNew} = 1;
00530     }
00531   }
00532   if ($part != $status->{part}) {
00533     main::TEXT('<input type="hidden" name="_noadvance" value="1" />');
00534     $self->{nextVisible} = 'IfCorrect' if lc($self->{nextVisible}) eq 'never';
00535   }
00536   return $status->{part};
00537 }
00538 
00539 #
00540 #  Return the various scores
00541 #
00542 sub score {shift->{status}{score}}
00543 sub scoreRaw {shift->{status}{raw}}
00544 sub scoreOverall {
00545   my $self = shift;
00546   return $self->{status}{score} + $self->{status}{total};
00547 }
00548 
00549 ######################################################################
00550 #
00551 #  The custom grader that does the work of computing the scores
00552 #  and saving the data.
00553 #
00554 sub grader {
00555   my $self = $main::PG->{flags}->{compoundProblem};
00556   #
00557   #  Get the answer names and the weight for the current part.
00558   #
00559   my @answers = keys(%{$_[0]});
00560   my $weight = scalar(@answers)/$self->{totalAnswers};
00561   $weight = $self->{weights}[$self->{status}{part}-1]/$self->{totalWeight}
00562     if $self->{weights} && defined($self->{weights}[$self->{status}{part}-1]);
00563   @answers = grep(!/$main::ANSWER_PREFIX/o,@answers) unless $self->{saveAllAnswers};
00564   push(@answers,@{$self->{extraAnswers}}) if $self->{extraAnswers};
00565   my $space = '<img src="about:blank" style="height:1px; width:3em; visibility:hidden" />';
00566 
00567   #
00568   #  Call the original grader, but put back the old recorded_score
00569   #  (the grader will have updated it based on the score for the PART,
00570   #  not the problem as a whole).
00571   #
00572   my $oldScore = ($_[1])->{recorded_score};
00573   my ($result,$state) = &{$self->{grader}}(@_);
00574   $state->{recorded_score} = $oldScore;
00575 
00576   #
00577   #  Update that state information and encode it.
00578   #
00579   my $status = $self->{status};
00580   $status->{raw}   = $result->{score};
00581   $status->{score} = $result->{score}*$weight;
00582   $status->{new_ans_rule_count} = $main::ans_rule_count;
00583   if (defined(%main::images_created)) {
00584     $status->{imageName} = (keys %main::images_created)[0];
00585     $status->{new_images_created} = $main::images_created{$status->{imageName}};
00586   }
00587   $status->{new_answers} = join(';',@answers);
00588   my $data = quoteHTML($self->encode);
00589 
00590   #
00591   #  Update the recorded score
00592   #
00593   my $newScore = $status->{total} + $status->{score};
00594   $state->{recorded_score} = $newScore if $newScore > $oldScore;
00595   $state->{recorded_score} = 0 if $self->{allowReset} && $main::inputs_ref->{_reset};
00596 
00597   #
00598   #  Add the compoundProblem message and data
00599   #
00600   $result->{type} = "compoundProblem ($result->{type})";
00601   $result->{msg} .= '</i><p><b>Note:</b> <i>' if $result->{msg};
00602   $result->{msg} .= 'This problem has more than one part.'
00603                  .  '<br/>'.$space.'<small>Your score for this attempt is for this part only;</small>'
00604          .  '<br/>'.$space.'<small>your overall score is for all the parts combined.</small>'
00605                  .  qq!<input type="hidden" name="_status" value="$data" />!;
00606 
00607   #
00608   #  Warn if the answers changed when they shouldn't have
00609   #
00610   $result->{msg} .= '<p><b>You may not change your answers when going on to the next part!</b>'
00611     if $self->{nextNoChange} && $self->{answersChanged};
00612 
00613   #
00614   #  Include the "next part" checkbox, button, or whatever.
00615   #
00616   my $par = 1;
00617   if ($self->{parts} > $status->{part} && !$main::inputs_ref->{previewAnswers}) {
00618     if (lc($self->{nextVisible}) eq 'always' ||
00619        (lc($self->{nextVisible}) eq 'ifcorrect' && $result->{score} >= 1)) {
00620       my $method = "next".$self->{nextStyle}; $par = 0;
00621       $result->{msg} .= $self->$method($self->{nextLabel},1).'<br/>';
00622     }
00623   }
00624 
00625   #
00626   #  Add the reset checkbox, if needed
00627   #
00628   $result->{msg} .= $self->resetCheckbox($self->{resetLabel},$par)
00629     if $self->{allowReset} && $status->{part} > 1;
00630 
00631   #
00632   #  Make sure we don't go on unless the next button really is checked
00633   #
00634   $result->{msg} .= '<input type="hidden" name="_next" value="0" />'
00635     unless $self->{nextInserted};
00636 
00637   return ($result,$state);
00638 }
00639 
00640 1;
Generated on Fri Jun 8 22:54:54 2012 for PG by  1.6.3
